title: Washington Post
description: Washington Post News Feed

title: Police: Barricade situation ‘safely resolved’ in Silver Spring area
dc:creator: Dana Hedgpeth
description: Police earlier told Silver Spring residents to shelter in place because of a barricade situation at an apartment complex.

title: Three warnings have been issued for Prince George’s curfew violations
dc:creator: Jasmine Hilton, Lateshia Beachum
description: Prince George’s County police have issued three curfew citations since the start of its enforcement.

title: Maryland woman dies after being struck by car in May
dc:creator: Dana Hedgpeth
description: The 64-year-old District Heights woman was trying to cross a road in the Morningside area on May 28 when a vehicle struck her.

title: D.C. wants to save at-risk people. Violence, missteps marred the effort.
dc:creator: Emily Davies, Peter Hermann, Keith L. Alexander
description: The city has yet to reach about half of those on its “People of Promise” list, and a top official graded the program as a C-plus.

title: D.C.-area forecast: Raw and occasionally rainy today with improvement on the way
dc:creator: Matt Rogers
description: Partial clearing on Wednesday before much nicer weather returns to end the week.

title: This prime minister laughed at the meme she inspired: #DespiteBeingAWoman
dc:creator: Petula Dvorak
description: Prime minister of Bangladesh Sheikh Hasina was in Virginia for a quiet visit with her grandkids, but word spread among expats, who swarmed the hotel to see her.

title: After Ian, working-class Pine Island braces for extended misery
dc:creator: Dan Lamothe
description: “We need to get people talking about Pine Island right now,” one resident said. "That's the most important thing."

title: Maryland appeals court hears arguments in toll lanes bid protest
dc:creator: Katherine Shaver
description: A bid protest by Spanish firm Cintra alleges Maryland improperly awarded a contract to design toll lanes for the Capital Beltway and I-270 to the Transurban team.

title: Loudoun substitute teacher charged with assaulting student
dc:creator: Hannah Natanson
description: A Loudoun substitute teacher was charged with assaulting a student.

title: Youngkin slams Virginia plan for wind, solar; calls for nuclear push
dc:creator: Gregory S. Schneider
description: Virginia Gov. Glenn Youngkin says the state's goal of ending fossil fuels is unrealistic, and proposes a new plan with natural gas and a big effort on nuclear energy.

title: D.C. mayor’s latest goal: 20,000 new Black homeowners by 2030
dc:creator: Michael Brice-Saddler
description: Members of the Black Homeownership Strike Force said the goal will help overcome historic, discriminatory housing policies once common throughout the United States that continue to fuel inequitable homeownership rates today.

title: Charges declined for Secret Service officers who fatally shot 19-year-old
dc:creator: Keith L. Alexander
description: Prosecutors say they found “insufficient evidence” the two officers used excessive force in the shooting of Gordon Casey outside the Peruvian ambassador’s home in April.

title: Jury finds D.C. man guilty of killing girlfriend, whose body was never found
dc:creator: Keith L. Alexander
description: Prosecutors argued that Darnell Sterling killed Olga Ooro in her D.C. apartment in 2020, then cleaned the crime scene and disposed of her body.

title: PM Update: More chilly rain is on the way through Tuesday
dc:creator: Ian Livingston
description: Another inch or two may fall before it stops midweek. Cool temperatures are also set to continue.

title: What you need to know about the Oath Keepers trial
dc:creator: Rachel Weiner, Spencer Hsu, Tom Jackman
description: Who are the Oath Keepers? What do we expect or hope to learn from the trial? What connection is there to President Trump? We answer your questions.

title: We predict the coolest and wettest October in 11 years in D.C.
dc:creator: Matt Rogers
description: It may be hard to come back from this cold and wet start to the month.

title: Who are the Oath Keepers going to trial on seditious conspiracy charges?
dc:creator: Rachel Weiner, Spencer Hsu, Tom Jackman
description: Among those on trial are Stewart Rhodes, who founded the extremist antigovernment group Oath Keepers in 2009.

title: How to get a monkeypox vaccine in the D.C. region
dc:creator: Jenna Portnoy
description: The District has recorded more monkeypox cases per capita than any state, and launched a vaccination effort targeting the at-risk community.

title: The National Theatre marvels at some 200-year-old theater gossip
dc:creator: John Kelly
description: The National Theatre was "very handsome and comfortable but has not been so well attended as it ought."

title: Police identify 22-year-old man fatally shot Sunday in Northwest D.C.
dc:creator: Emily Davies
description: Antonio Waller, of Northwest D.C., died on the scene.

title: More aid but no solutions for owners at crumbling D.C. condo building
dc:creator: Marissa Lang, Michael Brice-Saddler
description: Nearly all of the homeowners at the Anacostia building are Black women and first-time homebuyers who received loans through the city’s Home Purchase Assistance Program.

title: Coal jobs are almost gone. Could a casino help rescue southwest Virginia?
dc:creator: Gregory S. Schneider
description: Virginia's first casino has opened in Bristol, where residents hope money from gambling can help rescue a region down on its luck.

title: D.C.-area forecast: Rainy through Tuesday night, slow clearing after that
dc:creator: Jason Samenow
description: Sunny weather dominates Thursday through the weekend

title: Woman killed in Fairfax hit-and-run, police say
dc:creator: Martin Weil
description: She was struck at Annandale Road and Maple Place in the Annandale area.

title: Boy, 2, is shot and wounded in Prince George’s, police say
dc:creator: Emily Davies
description: D.C. police found the boy on the 2500 block of Q Street, SE but believe he was shot in Prince George’s.

title: Florida begins cleanup in aftermath of Ian as death toll climbs
dc:creator: Tim Craig, Antonio Olivo, Jeanne Whalen
description: The confirmed death toll from Hurricane Ian is expected to rise in Florida as people file reports of missing loved ones.

title: At St. Matthew’s 70th Red Mass, a celebration of God and good work
dc:creator: Michael Laris
description: On the day before the start of a new Supreme Court term in an America wrestling with deep divisions, D.C.’s Catholic leaders reprised a celebration of God and good work that has stretched 70 years.

title: Man fatally shot Sunday morning in Alexandria, police say
dc:creator: Emily Davies
description: Fairfax County Police officers said they expect the incident wasn't a random act.

title: PM Update: Showers and cool weather continue for Monday
dc:creator: Greg Porter
description: Add in some gusty winds from the north and we are locked in for some dreary conditions.

title: A White House fence’s Black Lives Matter art has been saved for history
dc:creator: Ellie Silverman
description: More than 1,500 artifacts from the Black Lives Matter Memorial Fence were saved and are now accessible in the D.C. Public Library’s online archive.

title: Two men fatally shot this weekend in Washington
dc:creator: Emily Davies
description: Ronald Porter was fatally shot on the 1300 block of Adams Street NE. Another adult male was killed Sunday in Northwest.
